reviews.review_msg: Great prof! Very caring and is straight up. Wants students to succeed and knows the right way to do so. Studied a lot himself so he has all the tips and tricks up his sleeve for success that you will need - talk to him!

I took this course in UBC 2019 W, and he was the best ECON prof I have ever met. His lectures were most engaging and I certainly learned a lot. I aced it with grade of 94. Even in my internships the trade models are of great help for me to have a better understanding of why my senior managers can make such decisions. I strongly recommend it!

The exams are hard and his last exam was on the last day of class. But he really cares about his students and put in the effort to help them. This is what I love about him. He gives options to improve our overall grade by offering different weight transfers, so I think he is fair.

Professor Hasan is the professor that I truly admire. Besides his caring for student mental health, great willingness to give career advice, His class is full of joy and wisdom. Highly recommend taking his Econ355 at UBC; learning International trade models and policy tools gives you a great advantage in doing Macro-analysis as an Econ student.
I like his enthusiasm for econ. He discusses trade theory with easy examples from real world that helps me to remember the outcomes.
He is new to UBC but he is a great teacher. Our class is only 50 minutes long each day so he kind of has to rush in more classes but he explains the concepts well. I will recommend him highly.
You need to self study in this class, otherwise it's difficult to learn
He is a nice professor! I really like his course. If you study hard, you will get really good grade!
he is a very helpful peofessor
One of the simplest classes, made lectures interesting with examples. Would take a class with him again, if possible.
Best professor ever. Didn't fail any students in his class this semester if you do all the exams and assignments. 5 assignments and only 600 words each. Should take 355 with him!
